Tag.description: A custom key-value pair associated with a resource within your organization.

properties.name: Key
properties.description: The key identifier, or name, of the tag.

type.description: The key identifier, or name, of the tag.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The string value that's associated with the key of the tag. You can set the value of a tag to an empty string, but you can't set the value of a tag to null.

type.description: The string value that's associated with the key of the tag. You can set the value of a tag to an empty string, but you can't set the value of a tag to null.

resource.description: Policies in AWS Organizations enable you to manage different features of the AWS accounts in your organization.  You can use policies when all features are enabled in your organization.

properties.name: Content
properties.description: The Policy text content. For AWS CloudFormation templates formatted in YAML, you can provide the policy in JSON or YAML format. AWS CloudFormation always converts a YAML policy to JSON format before submitting it.

types.description: The Policy text content. For AWS CloudFormation templates formatted in YAML, you can provide the policy in JSON or YAML format. AWS CloudFormation always converts a YAML policy to JSON format before submitting it.

The Policy text content. For AWS CloudFormation templates formatted in YAML, you can provide the policy in JSON or YAML format. AWS CloudFormation always converts a YAML policy to JSON format before submitting it.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: Human readable description of the policy

type.description: Human readable description of the policy

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created policy. For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value. You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to null.

type.description: A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created policy. For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value. You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to null.

properties.name: TargetIds
properties.description: List of unique identifiers (IDs) of the root, OU, or account that you want to attach the policy to

type.description: List of unique identifiers (IDs) of the root, OU, or account that you want to attach the policy to

properties.name: Type
properties.description: The type of policy to create. You can specify one of the following values: AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY, BACKUP_POLICY, SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY, TAG_POLICY

type.description: The type of policy to create. You can specify one of the following values: AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY, BACKUP_POLICY, SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY, TAG_POLICY

attributes.description: Policies in AWS Organizations enable you to manage different features of the AWS accounts in your organization.  You can use policies when all features are enabled in your organization.

properties.name: AwsManaged
properties.description: A boolean value that indicates whether the specified policy is an AWS managed policy. If true, then you can attach the policy to roots, OUs, or accounts, but you cannot edit it.

type.description: A boolean value that indicates whether the specified policy is an AWS managed policy. If true, then you can attach the policy to roots, OUs, or accounts, but you cannot edit it.
